titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Martin Witherspoon Gary papers, 1855-1879
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection includes documents, 1876, protesting election irregularities in Edgefield Co. by Republican and African-American voters; Gary's letter, 1877, to the editors of the Augusta "Chronicle and Constitutionalist," explaining his opposition to the acceptance by Southern Democrats of appointments from President Rutherford B. Hayes; and a letter, 1879, to the editor of the Abbeville "Medium," opposing the election of Wade Hampton to the U.S. Senate.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Martin Witherspoon Gary Papers, 1855-1879, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Martin Witherspoon Gary (1831-1881) was a lawyer and Confederate brigadier general.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes documents, 1876, protesting election irregularities in Edgefield Co. by Republican and African-American voters; Gary's letter, 1877, to the editors of the Augusta "Chronicle and Constitutionalist," explaining his opposition to the acceptance by Southern Democrats of appointments from President Rutherford B. Hayes; and a letter, 1879, to the editor of the Abbeville "Medium," opposing the election of Wade Hampton to the U.S. Senate.

controlaccess.subject: Voting -- South Carolina
controlaccess.geogname: United States -- Officials and employees -- Selection and appointment
